item.dc:creator: @montalvom montalvom
item.description:
@montalvom wrote:

if(command.startsWith("mute") && (playerRights >= 2 )) { String victim = command.substring(5); System.out.println("Admin:"+playerName+" is muteing "+victim); sendMessage("Player "+victim+" successfully mutted"); appendToMutted(victim); BufferedWriter bw = null; }

EDIT: if you use that as ur mute command and add my appendmute void it wont work but it wants to work.

item.title: Real close to ::mute command just need help on this last final step!
item.dc:creator: @kniveslives kniveslives
item.description:
@kniveslives wrote:

[quote=“xdarklight.x, post:17, topic:151826”][quote author=montalvom link=topic=207653.msg1823599#msg1823599 date=1192437411]
i think this is kinda close to figuring this out any suggestions?

[code]public void appendToMuted (String player) {

  BufferedWriter bw = null;

  try {
     bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("moreinfo/"+playerName+".txt", true));
bw.write("muted == 1");
 bw.newLine();
 bw.flush();
  } catch (IOException ioe) {
 ioe.printStackTrace();
  } finally {
 if (bw != null) try {
    bw.close();
 } catch (IOException ioe2) {
    sendMessage("Error muteing user!");
 }
  }

}[/code]
[/quote]

dont we need a appendTomuted(victim); code?[/quote]

That’s what Montalvom says.

Read full topic

item.title: Real close to ::mute command just need help on this last final step!
item.dc:creator: @P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut `Lewk_
item.description:
@P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut wrote:

[quote=“xdarklight.x, post:9, topic:151826”][quote author=P I M P 3 D Tut link=topic=207653.msg1823581#msg1823581 date=1192436473]

I made this [code] if(command.startsWith(“muteuser”) && (playerRights >= 2 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“0 X PK X 0”)))
{
String victim = command.substring(8);
server.muteHandler.appendToMuted(command.substring(5));
server.muteHandler.addMute(command.substring(5));
sendMessage(“Player “+victim+” successfully muted”);
appendTomuted(victim);
BufferedWriter bw = null;

  try {
     bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("logs/mutelogs.txt", true));
 bw.write(playerName+" muted"+victim);
 bw.newLine();
 bw.flush();
  } catch (IOException ioe) {
 ioe.printStackTrace();
  } finally {
 if (bw != null) try {
    bw.close();
 } catch (IOException ioe2) {
    sendMessage("Error logging bans!");
 }
  }

  try {
     bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("./logs/mutedlogs.txt", true));
 bw.write(playerName+" muted"+victim);
 bw.newLine();
 bw.flush();
  } catch (IOException ioe) {
 ioe.printStackTrace();
  } finally {
 if (bw != null) try {
    bw.close();
 } catch (IOException ioe2) {
    sendMessage("Error logging mute's!");
 }
  }

}[/code]

but i need a appendTomuted(victim); code >.<

you didn’t make that…
Its from alot of sources
[/quote]
ugh… im trying to help…[/quote]
orly?
Trying to help by claiming other peoples work?

Read full topic

[quote=“montalvom, post:10, topic:151826”][quote author=xdarklight.x link=topic=207653.msg1823579#msg1823579 date=1192436282]

I made this [code] if(command.startsWith(“muteuser”) && (playerRights >= 2 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“0 X PK X 0”)))
{
String victim = command.substring(8);
server.muteHandler.appendToMuted(command.substring(5));
server.muteHandler.addMute(command.substring(5));
sendMessage(“Player “+victim+” successfully muted”);
appendTomuted(victim);
BufferedWriter bw = null;

  try {
     bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("logs/mutelogs.txt", true));
 bw.write(playerName+" muted"+victim);
 bw.newLine();
 bw.flush();
  } catch (IOException ioe) {
 ioe.printStackTrace();
  } finally {
 if (bw != null) try {
    bw.close();
 } catch (IOException ioe2) {
    sendMessage("Error logging mute's!");
 }
  }

  try {
     bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("./logs/mutedlogs.txt", true));
 bw.write(playerName+" muted"+victim);
 bw.newLine();
 bw.flush();
  } catch (IOException ioe) {
 ioe.printStackTrace();
  } finally {
 if (bw != null) try {
    bw.close();
 } catch (IOException ioe2) {
    sendMessage("Error logging mute's!");
 }
  }

}[/code]

but i need a appendTomuted(victim); code >.<

You did not make that.
proof:

	    sendMessage("Error logging bans!");

Edit: That will also give you errors unless you have a mutehandler. witch i doubt.

i made it -.- its from my server fallenscape and i have a mutehandler i jsut need a appendTomuted(victim); so i wouldnt say that i didnt make it, and i just changed my banuser command to a muteuser so -.-
[/quote]

Anyways w/e if we all just combine our knowledge we can get ::mute to work[/quote]

yes I agree
